inn1.comm: full length to start, dabbed to midwicket and a tight call. Cook just makes his ground as the shy comes in
a swish and a miss outside off. That's a tempting line, angling across the left-hander
lovely line again, curving back in towards off stump, and just sneaking past the off stump. Looked like movement off the pitch there ...
outside off and shaping away this time. Mustard is in place for a cut, but leaves alone
clipped firmly off the toes, but straight to Jeetan Patel on the midwicket boundary
drawn forward and solidly defended into the covers
round the wicket, angling in to off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length, nudged to point where Jamie How swooped and shied. I think the batsman was just in, had the ball hit. Which it didn't
outside off and defended off the back foot
driven, off a slight inside-edge, squirts through midwicket, and they get a bonus two as McCullum fields the throw and shies without checking to see if the slips are awake. They were not
a hint of uneven bounce? Conceivably. That kept lower
outside off again, deflected to point
back of a length and a hint of width, but Mustard finds himself cramped for room with an attempted cut

oh dear, well, he was never going to hang around. A monstrous heave off a good length, a spiralling leading edge, and Jamie How judges the ball well at cover, as it holds up in the wind and plops from floodlight-height into his safe hands
drawn forward, defended into the covers
watchful defence, good line and length
onto his toes to drive, but can't find the gap. The ball is not coming onto the bat quite as it did at Napier
nips off the seam to complete a tidy over
upper-cut, and that's a loose stroke that flies agonisingly close to gully - but it's a no-ball, so a free hit coming up ...
low full toss - Cook makes room but can only shovel a single to mid-off
outside off, Bell doesn't even pretend interest in that one
short ball, dug into the ribs, which it locates with a loud "oof"
outside off, nipping back in, left alone again
short and angling in again, defended with a hop
short and zipping through, well wide of off stump. Good rhythmic over
outside off, left alone
clipped off the hip to fine leg
props forward with a vertical bat. Defended
pushed out to point. Tight line again
back of a length, defended again
an excellent over. England have nothing to work with whatsoever just yet
round the wicket, defended on off stump
whipped firmly, the ball was shaping down the leg-side, and Cook helped it on its way very nicely. England's first boundary of the match
defended off the back foot
drawn into the drive and beaten outside off. Nice bowling, just a hint of away movement off the seam
yorker length, dug out with ease and picked up in the covers
angling towards leg stump, turned to midwicket. Another tidy over
Bell comes down the pitch to drive, and chips the ball over square leg. Didn't quite go where intended, but good intent
tucked off the pads to midwicket
clipped sweetly off middle stump, but short midwicket intercepts
driven out to point
takes the aerial route, and does so well. Full straight drive, up and over the infield and through long-off. Lovely strike
fuller length, stoutly defended
yorker, outside off. Cook prods loosely but misses
another emphatic clip off the toes - that's the second time Martin has strayed onto Cook's pads, and he's paid the full price
bad bowling, feeding Cook's habit, and it's sheer good/bad luck that short fine leg was in the way of that shot. It was travelling
clipped again, Martin has lost his line badly, but just one more to the total
brilliant shot, hitting on the up and piercing the off-side field to perfection.  Not a slog in sight, just text-book cover-driving
very nicely done - opening the face on contact to thread the ball in front of point. Wonderful driving, and it just has the legs to cross the rope
outside off, and beaten
good line and length, pitching on middle and angling across towards off
loud shout for lbw, but that pitched a fraction outside leg, and might have been high as well. Otherwise plumb
two steps down the track for Bell, but Mills spots him coming and adjusts well
driven solidly again - he's really finding the middle of the bat at the mo. But mid-off fields
defended on the front foot
outside off from round the wicket, defended out to point
tighter to off stump, good length again and defended
defended again on off stump
wider of the crease, but tight to the stumps again. A loud shout of "no!"
very tidy line and length, defended again. No freebies here
tucked off the hips, no run there either. A very tight first ten overs
a swish, a miss, a pad and a leg bye as the ball dribbles behind square on the off
back and flicked through a large space at midwicket
he gives Mills the change and he responds with a short one outside off. Good thinking by the batsman and a sharp response from the bowler
again comes to meet the ball, slightly short but he has enough room to swat it to mid-on, but too cramped for the big hit
heaved along the ground to deep midwicket
pushed defensively to extra cover
outside off, edgy cut to third man
pushed into the off
short, launched high to deep midwicket, it hangs in the air but Patel has a lot of ground to make up from deep square leg and it plops safely two thirds of the way to the boundary
patted into the off side
low full toss, pushed more than hit to the right of Oram and it bisects mid-off and mid-on
angled in to Bell who has to settle for patting the ball back to the bowler
tight line, poked defensively back at the bowler
shapes to cut but cannot get much power into the shot and point's hands are hardly sore after stopping that
looks to swing one from outside off stump over the leg-side field but misses and McCullum takes
another ugly cross-batted hoick, this time he connects and gets the single to midwicket
fired at Bell's body, he looks to swivel-pull but misses and takes the ball in the gut
driven from the crease, the ball was on the stumps but Bell had moved to leg to give himself more room
slashing drive in the air but just to the left of backward point who was at full stretch
flicked from middle stump square on the leg side
short, pulled from outside off stump to Patel at deep midwicket
blocked with about as much foot movement as I show at the crease ... ie none
he comes down the pitch, stops, it's short and he pulls behind square and iut beats the sprawling deep midwicket haring to his left
driven, slightly edgily, but it's past point and no way can third man get round
half volley, he looks to hit over long-off but underclubs and Flynn, a yard or so in from the boundary, takes a good catch in front of his face
outside off, no shot
blocked back to the bowler
turned rather lazily into the leg side to get off the mark
on leg stump, worked to the man two thirds back square of the wicket
defended watchfully
quicker one, pitches on leg, straightens and Cook is caught in his crease. It looked banged to rights and the umpire has no doubts either
clipped firmly to the right of midwicket, on the walk and with whippy wrists
driven to extra cover and he's off for the single comewhat may ... no alarms
very correct jabbed defensive prod into the covers
firm push to the left of point, he has to jog to get it and that allows an easy one

schoolboy misfield ... driven to Martin at extra cover and he jogs in and completely misses the ball and has to turn and sprint after it ... one becomes three and Martin wants the ground to open up and swallow him
driven from outside off stump to mid-on
form off drive, and another misfield ... one -handed stop which deflects into his body and from there scoots away from him
Pietersen content to pick the gaps and milk the ones while he finds his sights
pushed to mid-off who is in saving the one
hurriedly jabs down after deciding to play back
tight and mean, Cook can do no more than defend
into the pad as Pietersen  shapes to poke into space on the leg side
cut-poked into the packed cover region
two steps to make a decent ball into a half volley which he turns to deepish midwicket
clipped to mid-on
tucked off his pads to deep square leg
again uses his feet and pushes the ball into the leg side, Vettori charges after it like an enthusiastic schoolboy but was never going to prevent the run
mistimed drive which Styris fields neatly
wristy flick from off stump to square leg
short and wide, Cook misses out with a horribly weak cut
easy drive through the covers but there's a man in the deep on patrol for that very shot
driven to long-on, 15 yards in from the boundary
through the poke and into his pads, McCullum appeals more to clear his throat than in any expectation of an lbw
he comes down the track, Vettori fires it wide, and KP plays one of those trademark reaching drives from way wide of his body, through extra cover and four
hammered back at the bowler ...not so much a stop as a direct hit but no run whatever
slower ball, Pietersen waits and pushes to mid-on. That was 47mph
quicker but slightly short, Cook back and turns to square leg
punched into the ground at his feet, McCullum fields a bobbler
outside off, Pietersen watches it pass with a very snooty air
cut to point
uppish push to mid-on
defended watchfully
and another circumspect poke to one outside off
wider and driven hard, extra cover dives to his right, an easy stop
turned to leg with a late flick of the wrists
swept to long leg, controlled and it trundles all along the ground
pulled hard from outside off slap-bang to midwicket
looser one down the leg side, turned to deepish midwicket
solid defensive push back to Vettori
looks to turn to leg but gets a leading edge and it squirts into the off side, no chance as it kept low
pushed to cover, Pietersen sets off, Cook yelps and sends him back
pushed down the ground to long-off
pulled with a flamingo-like one-legged twirl, Mills slides and flicks back at cow corner and a colleague throws
single to square leg
short fine leg into play
up to long-off ... almost batting by numbers, singles at will, New Zealand happy to give them, England happy to take them. It's this aspect of ODIs that people moan about ...
a single to long-on
pushed a yard short of midwicket
unconvincing cut behind square
stands tall and drives to cover
again subdued drive into the off side
swept to short fine leg, he shies at the bowler's end but never a chance of a run out
sweeps, misses, a loud appeal but not really likely to be considered let alone given
wild sweep to one about a yard outside off which he misses ... not surprisingly
pushed, placed through the covers, Pietersen is quick and that allows him to scamper back for the second
lovely shot, a half volley hammered straight, low and long-on never in the race. Loads of bottom hand in that one
more conventional drive trundles to long-off
Cook plays an on drive, not as much power and the fielder in the deep is much straighter as Stryis going round the wicket
flatter and faster, Pietersen a little surprised and forced to defend
quicker one, pitches on leg, straightens and Cook is caught in his crease. It looked banged to rights and the umpire has no doubts either
turned square to the man on the edge of the circle
a step and a bit, taken on the pads
languid drive along the ground to long-on
pushed firmly back to Vettori
again Vettori fields, a few cheers from spectators who thought that was a catch
single to long-on
driven into the covers but not into a space
flicked to midwicket, Patel hurtles in from the deep ...77mph (the delivery, not Patel)
dead batted into the off side
short midwicket fields a nudge off the pads
tight stuff from Oram, no run as the ball is steered into the covers
short midwicket fields
pushed into the off side
cut to deep backward point
edge onto the pad, a half appeal, Collingwood hesitates, Pietersen on his way, and Collingwood has to hurry to get in at the non-striker's end ... the throw was wild anyhow
tickled to short fine leg, he's in quickly to prevent the single
very watchful and upright defensive dead bat
defended, Oram quickly to his right to gather
mid-off in quickly to field a push. Oram tight line-to-line stuff
third time lucky in finding the gap, turned to the right of midwicket
steps back and cuts to deepish cover
flicked hard but he can't get it either side of midwicket
patted back obligingly to Oram
swept with real oomph to Ryder in the shade of the stands at deep midwicket
lovely one-handed sliding stop at deep square leg by Mills saves two
clipped to wide long-on
dribbled a few feet down the track
crouching defensive push
and again a very non ODI poke
outside off, a hint of turn. Defended

the sucker punch! One sighter, then the monstrous heave over midwicket. But Patel held that one up a touch, and Jesse Ryder circled in the deep to take a comfortable chance. That's a major blow to England's ambitions
a circumspect response that time. Patel won't be underestimated again in a hurry
fully forward and a firm defence
a hint of width and cut firmly, but straight to point
tucked off the pads, but midwicket tidies up. Great over for New Zealand
pushed to point
turned off the toes, straight to Patel, and a single is wisely turned down. That could have been catastrophic
steered out to midwicket again
rotating the strike again
"aww yes Dannie" is the cry, as this one is uneasily defended on off stump
tucked into the gully
sizing up a single off the hip, but turned back ... wisely again. "A touch of the Vicar of Dibleys" suggests David Lloyd
a single this time ...
forward and defended doggedly
finds the gap in the covers with a back-foot push
two steps down the track but no way through there
driven back down the pitch at a fair lick, and a loud appeal as the ball cannons into the stumps off the bowler's fingertips. Umpire Bowden is satisfied that his bat was grounded though ...
carved off the back foot
quick feet and whipped to midwicket
driven off the back foot through point
an ambitious hoick across the line, but no contact whatsoever. "How was that?" enquires McCullum politely

a stunning delivery, rips past Collingwood's floundering edge, drags him out of the crease, and McCullum whips off the bails in an instant! Superb delivery, and as the strains of Coronation Street play out across the stadium, the skipper has to depart
rips past the edge again. Gremlins in the pitch all of a sudden
tentatively played again
bat on ball, but watchfully done. England are wobbling at the moment
ambitiously shovelled to mid-on. No power but plenty intent
rock-solid forward defence
quick feet, and defended
pushed out to midwicket
quicker delivery, and defended again
more flight this time, but more defence
forward and blocking. England can only see Vettori off at the moment
desperate dive back into the crease, more chaotic calling as the ball glides into the gully. But Wright gets back just in time
defended, to complete a maiden over. Superbly bowled
pushed out to point
shovelled through the leg side, picks the gap well to beat mid-on. Well placed and timed
width, and carved ambitiously into the covers, but can't beat the sweeper
pushed off the back foot, and a jogged single
whirled onto a good length, and defended again
clumped down the ground, but to no great avail. Another fine over
wicket-to-wicket delivery. Defended on off stump
slower delivery, slogged off a good length, on one knee and clean over midwicket. He can hit a cricket ball, this boy
offcutter, but a quicker one. Nudged down to gully
onto the toes to cut into the point region. Fielded with one hand
turned off the toes through midwicket, keen running picks up the extra notch on the scoreboard
up onto the toes to steer into the gully, strange antics with the fielding, shies going everywhere, but no alarms for the batsmen
a fraction short, swung away through midwicket. Fielded on the bounce in the deep
drawn forward and defended
a big arcing swing of the blade, but not timed. Mid-on fields
pushed back into the crease, defended to gully
a quick single into the leg side, McCullum makes great ground from behind the stumps to ping down a shy at the non-striker's end. But safely home
pushed into the covers, and that's the end of the over
defended again, England can't up their urgency just yet
that was a more urgent shot, but it clobbered the non-striker Wright, in the chest! No damage, but no runs either, which is probably more upsetting
down on one knee, slog-swept over midwicket. Good strike
beaten outside off stump, great bowling
whipped to midwicket from outside off stump
width outside off stump, and carved out to deep point. Another tidy over for New Zealand
backward point fields
floated at 48mph, driven to deep mid-on
driven straight, Patel half stops, the non striker sets off and has to lunge back as the ball only went a few feet and Patel recovered quickly
driven to straight and deep mid-on
turned to midwicket who is onto it swiftly
flatter and 64mph, helped into the leg side
fired in at 77mph, a real toe tapper and he does well to dig it out
low full toss, driven to long-off
half volley flicked to a tumbling midwicket
low full toss as he goes for the yorker, turned to wide long-on , Shah turns down a second which was probably there
checked drive to long-on
a bit of a heave, along the ground, to long-off
turned to square leg
pushed to long-on ... this is really quite turgid stuff.
thank you ... down on one knee and dragged over midwicket, a dozen or so rows back
in the blockhole, he gets in a muddle but keeps it out
driven, but with no power,  to extra cover
turned with soft hands to midwicket who has gone deeper to allow the single
full and straight, Wright can do no more than defend
frustration shows as he swings and thuds the ball into the ground
wide and full, good enough drive but slap-bang to extra cover
wide and full again, a swing and a miss, lovely low take by McCullum who whips the bails off to underline how in command he is
outside off and again extra cover fields the drive
finally gets one off the square,. a one-kneed cut to deep point
turned from outside off to wide mid-on
flatter, again pushed to long-on who ambles in
knee-high full toss, wide mid-on again ... almost scoring by numbers and NZ will not worry about the singles at this stage
tip and run to extra cover who is back on the edge of the circle
half volley ... yup, mid-on again
pushed to extra cover
pushed to extra cover ... man back ... easy single etc
flatter and a brisk 79mph, midwicket fields
premeditated paddle-sweep from outside off, in the air and one bounce to deep backward square leg
well, that was improvisational ... looked to sweep, Ryder followed and he scoop-paddled over the slips and very fine for four
low and wide full toss, Wright down on a knee and smashes a flat six over point ... into the builders lorries
hit straight down the ground
another off-side maximum ... gives himself room outside off stump and slams that over the top
a wide full toss which he doesn't get hold of, Taylor ten yards in at long-off waits and takes a routine catch
low full toss hit hard and straight, long-on dives but can't cut it off ... and his trousers fall down as he slides to add to his embarrassment
yorker-length outside off, squeezed to point

wide and slightly short, Shah slashes, gets a thin edge and McCullum takes a really good catch and doesn't he know it ... he sets off on a whooping celebration and well he might. A catch like that standing up is always hard ...
languid drive past a diving extra cover, the sweeper in to mop up
square drive, deep point can't stop it but the sweeper can
driven to the left of long-off, Mascarenhas wanted two from the start and in the end made it comfortably
lovely yorker, dug out to backward point
another yorker, outside off, McCullum stops with his fingers and pads
whipped off his pads - almost another yorker - but fine leg chases it down ...
slash-drive, not middled, to long-on
driven, Broad jumps over it as it passes, long-on fields
right up there, Mascarenhas can do no more than drive to long-off
full toss swatted between deep midwicket and wide long-on ... a poor delivery but he was on it quickly and it bounced two yards short of the rope
back to yorker length, dug out to long-on
low full toss outside off, again all he can do is drive to long-off
driven to deep midwicket, very open
long-on fields a drive
in the slot and Mascarenhas launches that straight, high and long ... clears the sightscreen and plops into the mud behind it
driven to Taylor at long-on and they sprint the second
cracked through the covers, into the gap and four all the way
carved from outside the off stump and that goes many a mile over wide long-on .. slower but in the slot

driven to Taylor at long-on, Mascarenhas wants two and the throw to McCullum is decent but no more ... McCullum whips off the bails and it's tight ... two replays look as if he is in ...  the third looks tighter ... but he gets the benefit to a smattering of boos

well bowled, speared in at his feet, he digs it to Taylor in the firing line at long-on, again Mascarenhas wants a second but no drama this time as Taylor misfields. Persevering with Ryder was an expensive gamble ... his last three overs went for 45.  As a one or two-over shock tactic he seems to have value ...

inn2.comm: a bit of shape off the wicket, into the left-hander. Not a bad sighter
good length, angling back towards off. Defended with a big stride
massive shout, and that is very close! Conceivably pitched outside leg ... but there wasn't a lot wrong with it. Lucky
slides down leg
probing length again, a fraction short of full. If that makes sense. Either way, defended
zips through and cramps Ryder for room on the cut. Probing stuff
another big shout, but this time there's definitely bat on it. Good over, so much better than Napier it's hard to believe he's the same bowler
nice start, outside off and shaping back in
steps down the track and a good-looking drive, nearly a mix-up in the running
pushed back onto the stumps, and defends
slides down leg
dropped - a tough chance, Bell at cover diving away to his right. Nearly stuck, but that was fiercely struck
wide of off stump and late movement. Mustard can't gather, but gully saves the single
tighter line across the right-hander, McCullum misses with an attempted cut
short and angling across the left-hander, Ryder fishes limply, but doesn't connect
slower ball, yorker length, steered out to point
slides down leg, Mustard gathers well
late swing, but steered off the pads to fine leg
full and too much width, and Ryder doesn't miss those. Bat on ball is all that's needed, and that speeds past point
better line, no stroke offered
well bowled again, back of a length but tight to off stump. Left alone
a bit of room to swing the arms and Collingwood at point has to blink into the sun to field that
big appeal but pitched outside leg. Definite signs of swing though
good lift on off stump, defended to point with an angled bat
that's sweetly timed. Just opening the face and driving in front of square. Not a whole lot wrong with that line or length
pushed down to backward square
opens the face again and glides out to gully
short, and uppercut over point, all the way over the rope! Wonderful timing
pulled fiercely out to deep midwicket but well rescued on the boundary's edge
defended into the covers
short and wide once again, McCullum loses his grip on the bat in his eagerness to clobber that. High and handsome over cover, and one bounce inches inside the rope
line and length all wrong, and McCullum demonstrates the power that makes him a must-have for Indian Premier League franchises. Clobbered through the covers to complete a sorry over for Anderson
stands tall in the crease to steer the ball into the covers
slower ball, attempted yorker, but pushed with disdain and timing all the way to long-on, where Mascarenhas's dive can't save the boundary. Runs are flowing
back of a length, Ryder rides the bounce to steer the ball to gully
angling back in off the seam, defended on middle and leg
ill-directed, and though that flicked the bat - in Asad Rauf's opinion - it got what it deserved. Too full, too leg-sided, and Mustard can't intercept
pushed to point off the back foot
that's the same delivery - width outside off, and too short as well. Flailed through the covers
better line and length, and it's rewarded with a good piece of fielding in the covers
dropped - short, wide and smacked, deserved to be four, but instead it was a fantastic effort from Cook, diving to his left. It needed to be taken though ...
pushed into the off side
opens the face and steers to gully, a slight fumble gifts a single
tighter line to finish, but the damage has been done in the last few overs. England need a breakthrough urgently
speared down the leg side, but flicks the pad to prevent a wide
up onto the toes, pushed down to third man
dropped - the keeper ploy works, but the catch goes down. McCullum swings from the crease, gets a spiralling top-edge and Broad  at third man can't get a finger on it as he runs round to field
short, and absolutely beasted into the midwicket stands. Salt in the wounds
stand and deliver! Opens the shoulders, swings through the line, and clean over mid-on
clipped off the toes, and some keystone Cops fielding as three men converge in the deep and nutmeg each other. Oh dear
tighter line. Ryder has been relatively subdued, not that it's mattering at the moment
dabbed into the off side
the skipper shows how it should be done with a superb pounce in the covers. Cuts off at least two
delicate steer down to third man. Open face, and Mascarenhas fields well on the boundary
too short, too much width, heaved through midwicket. That's a bit rank from Broad, but what superb timing
too short, but at least it's straighter. Third man fields as McCullum glides one off the face of the bat
short and on the pads, no expansive response from Ryder, just a dismissive clip off his toes
what a way to go to fifty! Heaved up up and away, into the second tier of the midwicket grandstand, where it is superbly caught one-handed in the crowd. Just 27 balls for that fifty. Monstrous
launched. Utterly launched. Over the covers and into the building site. This is astounding hitting
three in a row! And it's the hospitality boxes this time. Another limp length ball inviting the aggressive heave. Guileless bowling from Anderson. Once again
low full toss, smacked into the covers, where a misfield gives McCullum the strike
pushed into the off side for an easy run
opens the face and steers into space on the off side
steps to leg, Broad follows and McCullum can only defend to an inrushing midwicket

steps back and absolutely crashes that behind square. Had anyone got in the way they would be heading to the first-aid centre ... that was a blur as it fizzed to the boundary and it crashed into the hoardings
hammered along the ground to long-off
outside off, Ryder aims a loose drive and misses
pushed gently into the covers

McCullum calls Ryder for a sharp single, he's slow to respond and as he struggles to make his ground his bat jams into the pitch and is torn out of his hand ... he'd have been on his way anyway as Pietersen at cover picked up and threw down the off stump
pushed to cover but no run this time
defended into the off side
very carefully defended, angled bat so the ball thuds into the pitch at his feet
gently swinging away, cut but not timed and point fields
driven to deep extra cover
tries to run the ball fine on the off side but misses and Mustard, standing up, takes neatly
this time he manages to steer the ball to third man
pushed firmly between point and extra cover
defended ... very tame stuff
turned to short mid-on, a rather daft run and had Broad hit at the non-striker's end   then How would have been well short
patted to mid-on
driven to deepish cover, Shah fields and slings in a return at Mustard's feet
turned off his hips to deep midwicket
another easy single into the leg side
turned to short midwicket
very correct forward defence, almost mockingly so
well-timed drive to Anderson at long-off
odd and not timed shot ... more of a scoop over mid-off, but it had the height to clear the man and the legs to outpace him
another solid defensive barrier
driven on the up in the air, mid-on dives to his left and takes the pace off it
slightly inside-out and edgy drive to cover
once more he misses as he attempts to run the ball fine off the open face
tip and run continues
solid defence
slightly cramped and the straight drive is easily cut off
turned through midwicket
dropped ... loose drive on the up back at the feet of Collingwood, he gets down but can't hold on with his left hand
the briefest of reprieves for McCullum, he aims to heave the ball over midwicket, misses, and the off stump is pegged back
upright drive to short extra cover
square drive to point
on drive but with the circle fairly well populated there are precious few sneaky singles to be had
but some sneaky fours, an off drive threaded between fielders, it races through extra cover where there did not seem to be a gap
cracking shot, the straightest of on drives and that's four all the way
two fours is enough, so he's happy to defend the final ball of the over
thick and genuine edge, flies through second slip and beats third man
another edge, more controlled, Broad right in line and it goes through his legs ... perfect bisection and Sidebottom stands perplexed
edged to Broad, a massive cheer as he picks it up cleanly and returns. He gives a wry smile
straight, defended, Sidebottom follows through, contemplates a sledge and then decides against it
super delivery, swinging across the right hander and it beats the edge as he prods
back and pushed to extra cover
cut hard to third man  past a diving slip ...quite safe
wide and flat-batted , Anderson gets enough of a hand on it diving to his left at mid-off to save the four
thick edge as he aims to drive over the top, it squirts to Wright at deep backward point on the bounce
misses as he tries to cut ... far too close to him really
to mid-on, a brief thought of a run but no more than that
cut very fine off a thick edge, it would have been straight to slip had he not been moved out two balls earlier ...
a play and a miss outside off
pushed to Pietersen who picks up well but then fires in a loose return to the bowler
wild throw from Wright at the bowler's end even though there was no chance of a run out
angled to deep point
blocked ... he can do this as much as he likes as they are so on top
turned to leg, a momentary yes-no interlude before they settle on no
forward and hunchingly defended into the covers
full and swinging down the leg side, helped into the midwicket area
slower ball - 64mph - driven straight, half stopped and deflected to mid-on
driven to short midwicket
pushed up to deepish mid-on
turned into the leg side but at the fielder
fullish, worked to mid-on with minimal effort
short, he steps back but an attempted pull bobbles limply into the leg side
steps back, upright and defends to mid-off
short and outside off, How steps to leg and aims a wild slash, gets a thin top edge and Mustard holds on
tickled to long leg ... Sidebottom would up as that was a tad over 89mph
good length and angled across, left alone
decent length on off stump, blocked
no pace but on the button and again he defends
driven to Mascarenhas who fails to pick the ball up on his first and second attempts
seams through a half prod and into the pads, a rasping, imploring appeal but Bowden not interested
full toss turned to midwicket
pushed into the off side where the man at cover is slightly deeper
angled across the right hander who allows it through
forward and a thickish edge scoots to point
outside off and cut uppishly to third man where Mascarenhas fields on the bounce
pushed towards cover
angled across from over the wicket, once more Taylor happy to shoulder arms
and a carbon copy, good length swinging across and Taylor will not nibble
firmly clipped to midwicket
gentle on drive, mid-on ambles to his left to cut it off
opens the face and plays a safe glide through a non existent slip
firm drive, extra cover dives but can't stop cleanly
slower ball outside off, a push and a miss, Mustard misses as it keeps low but the ball hits his pads and ricochets into the stumps
swished to midwicket
angled to backward point
Collingwood in from backward point to field a gentle push
very fine tickle through the space at slip and another four down there. Mascarenhas shakes his head but it was deliberate and safe
turned off his legs square
short, pulled but not timed, midwicket fields
driven to mid-off
off the pads into the leg side
keeps low and through a rather nothing push
pushed to mid-on
he waits and then flicks to midwicket but he can't find any space
down the leg side, past an attempted flick, through Mustard and four wides
good length, pushed to midwicket
pushed into the off side
all very low key, no need for the batsman to hurry
Styris content to take his time, and he has plenty of it
gentle poke into the covers
moves across to sweep, misses, a loud appeal but it hit him outside the line
patted back to the bowler
patted to mid-on
full length, driven out to midwicket
dabbed down to gully, called through for a quick single
a shimmy across the stumps, and chipped into space on the leg side, safely done
low full toss, driven hard down the ground, and gloriously so. No cutting that off
played out to mid-off
drawn forward and a measured push to long-on. Easy runs, and New Zealand are coasting
in the slot, and clobbered back over the bowler's head. Too full for that pace
nurdled to midwicket, no need for big shots every ball
dabbed down to gully
in the air briefly, but fell short of Cook at midwicket
cut to point
that's a better line and length, tight to off stump, and just short enough to require an honest stroke
outside off and angling in from back of a length, defended
turned square off a closed face
filthy long-hop, and Styris had all day to get into position and smash that through midwicket. England have been abject in places today
forced through midwicket with an exaggerated roll of the wrists
fuller length, but still not full in the fullest sense. Still, it's a dot ball I suppose. He's only bowled 14 of them today
wide and wild, down the leg side
clipped to midwicket and fielded on the bounce by Pietersen
down the leg side, pretty average delivery and nudged off the hip
better line, outside off stump, and played out to point
short and climbing at the gloves, but coolly steered off the hip to square leg
rising delivery on off stump. Played down to gully
straying onto leg stump, tucked away for one more
a bit of width and an attractive cover drive - but straight to the fielder at short cover
still straying onto leg stump, tucked away behind square
pushed up to cover
angling down leg again, but lucky for Anderson that must have brushed the pad because it's not given as a wide
another indifferent delivery, and an even more indifferent shot - wide outside off and wellied to Broad at wide mid-off. A breakthrough.
short, and ducked. Billy Bowden signals that's his one for the over
a jaffa. How unexpected! Pitches on off, explodes off the seam, and beats the bat. Too little, too late. Surely?
big stride forward, and defended
tip and run, into the covers

that's utterly plumb, and suddenly there's a bit of excitement about this game. Pitches on off, nips back, and Flynn's front foot is planted. A sad end to his debut innings, but there's a finish in prospect now ...

my goodness me, that is an incredible delivery! Perfect line and length, nips back through the gate and detonates the off stump! Sidebottom is going mental, and England are officially back in this now ...!
dabbed out to midwicket to get off the mark
defended on off stump, Sidebottom pounces in his follow through, and that's the end of a very fine over
wide, angled across the left hander and Anderson might have had a nervous moment as he waited to see if he would get away with it
tighter line, pushed to mid-off
the ball zips past the outside edge, a loud appeal from behind the wicket but Billy Bowden yet again unmoved. Anderson looks bewildered ... Vettori stands utterly stony faced
straight and full, defended
flicked off his toes square, Wright makes a sprawling, sliding save on the  boundary edge
good length on off stump, defended
good line and length, Vettori into the right position to block
too wide slanting away as the ball goes across him, not tempted
fractionally short outside off, Vettori plays a rather nothing cut under the ball by some way
short on leg stump ... on another day with another umpire that would be called a wide
firm front-foot drive through cover, not timed that well and the chasing fielders overhaul it with ease
leans back and cuts with no real power to point
full on off stump, very correct defensive push back to the right of Anderson who leans across to field
almost a carbon-copy ball and shot
short and wide, he leans back and cuts, getting a thick outside edge but quite safe and it shoots to the backward-point boundary
off the pad behind square on the leg side
flicked behind on the leg side for an easy run
short and wide again and that's a gift, punched from the crease through the covers
